messages.content: 1. Definition of Abortion Abortion is a medical procedure that ends a pregnancy. It is considered safe and effective when performed in a clinical setting. (Source ) 2. Types of Abortion There are two main types of abortion: in-clinic abortion and medication abortion. In-clinic abortions involve medical instruments and gentle suction, while medication abortions involve taking pills that cause cramping and bleeding to expel the pregnancy tissue. (Source ) 3. In-Clinic Abortion Procedure During an in-clinic abortion, a healthcare provider may use pain medication and possibly sedation to ensure comfort. The procedure typically lasts about 5 to 10 minutes, and patients are monitored afterward in a recovery area. (Source ) 4. Medication Abortion Process A medication abortion usually involves taking two medications: mifepristone, which blocks the hormone necessary for pregnancy growth, followed by misoprostol, which causes cramping and bleeding to expel the pregnancy tissue. (Source ) 5. Legal Considerations The legality of abortion varies by location. Some states impose restrictions or bans, while others allow it. It is important to check local laws regarding abortion access, as well as any specific regulations that may apply to minors. (Source ).

citation_objects.title: What Facts About Abortion Do I Need Know
What Happens During An In Clinic Abortion
